article.headline: Providence 77, Northeastern 72
article.story: Providence, R.I. -- Providence guard Marshon Brooks had 27 points and eight rebounds, paving the way for a 77-72 victory over Northeastern on Wednesday night. Northeastern's Chaisson Allen paced the Huskies with 24 points and Joel Smith had 15. Alex Harris scored 11 points and added three steals for Northeastern. The Huskies (2-3) jumped out to an 11-2 lead, and controlled the game for the first 10 minutes. After shooting 10-for-12 from the field in the first 8 minutes, Northeastern found itself ahead 31-20. Providence (7-1) then put together a 15-6 run that cut the lead to two at halftime. Northeastern stretched its lead to six points, but the Friars' 10-2 run midway through the half put Providence in front 55-51, and Northeastern did not lead again.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
